message:
The text or history? Does the text - jurisdiction - mean anything to Reason magazine? The 14th amendment was NEVER meant to provide birth right citizenship. It was meant to provide citizenship to former slaves and their children. The textual intent is that citizens of OTHER NATIONS who have children
[...Content omitted due to length constraints...]
citizen. It is equally absurd to think the intent of the 14th amendment was to provide citizenship to any illegal alien's offspring should they manage to squirt out a child on American soil. Another idiotic policy that has been established by the courts in defiance of the amendments original intent.

message:
White privilege is being able to walk down the street at night and not having to worry about being shot by a cop. It is simply the """"radical"""" idea that society favors white people over people of color, and it is completely prevalent in every aspect of life. Having privilege
[...Content omitted due to length constraints...]
have for free, and that is not what white privilege is. White privilege is knowing that when you wake up the next day, society will treat you with the respect that you deserve, the respect that strangely disappears when society interacts with a person of color. Don't be fucking ignorant.

message: Also, the slavery argument... Muslims have had multi millions in slavery, from all over the known world in biblical times. Slaves in excess of 100 million. American slave owners had 30 million at their peak, which lasted from roughly 1750's - 1860's. On behalf of everything you make an argument about (white Christians) I'm sorry, but I never owned a slave, nor do I condone slavery. So whatever a white guy did 200 years ago, I'm sorry. But Muslims still own slaves today. Check out Africa. Maybe you've heard of it.
